timeline.message:
Fixes #5217 - Review RoundRobinConnectionPool

Introduced IndexedConnectionPool and RandomConnectionPool.
Clarified semantic of RoundRobinConnectionPool.

Signed-off-by: Simone Bordet <simone.bordet@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: I think the cache should be forced to false, otherwise you risk reaching a steady state where one thread continuously uses the connection at the same index.
timeline.author: lorban

replies.bodyText: I think there shouldn't be a cache and it should be replaced by round robin: see #5218
replies.author: gregw

timeline.bodyText: When the integer goes overflows, you will start going the opposite way around the the pool
timeline.author: gregw

replies.bodyText: could always use the overflow throwing behavior of Math.addExact(int, int) to trap that.
replies.author: joakime

replies.bodyText:
It might not be a problem, and unlikely to happen anyway.... but easily fixed with:
            return index.getAndUpdate(c -> Math.max(0, c + 1)) % maxConnections;

replies.bodyText: And I have an even better solution in the latest code.
